user_error_text: No audio output started after Windows update
symptoms: No sound from speakers/headphones, volume shows activity but no sound
cause: Wrong output device selected, muted app, or driver issue
step_1: Click the speaker icon and choose the correct playback device; test sound.
step_2: Open Volume Mixer and ensure apps are not muted.
step_3: Restart Windows Audio services: services.msc → restart Windows Audio and Endpoint Builder.
step_4: Uninstall audio device in Device Manager and restart to allow reinstall.
step_5: If using external speakers, test on another device to rule out hardware failure.
verification: Audio input/output works for calls, recordings and media playback without distortion or dropouts.
log_snippet: Driver: No audio output - driver installation failed

user_error_text: Microphone not working and troubleshooting did not fix it
symptoms: Mic shows no input in sound settings; callers can't hear you
cause: Muted mic, wrong input device, driver or permission issues
step_1: Open Sound Settings → Input and select the correct microphone; test mic.
step_2: Ensure physical mute is off and volume is up on mic/USB headset.
step_3: Check microphone permissions: Settings → Privacy → Microphone → Allow apps.
step_4: Reinstall microphone driver from Device Manager or vendor site.
step_5: Test mic on another device or use a different USB port for USB mics.
verification: Audio input/output works for calls, recordings and media playback without distortion or dropouts.
log_snippet: Driver: Microphone not working - driver installation failed

user_error_text: Audio driver missing and troubleshooting did not fix it
symptoms: No audio devices listed; Device Manager shows exclamation
cause: Driver uninstalled, corrupted, or removed by update
step_1: Open Device Manager and scan for hardware changes to try reinstalling drivers.
step_2: Download and install audio drivers from OEM/motherboard vendor website.
step_3: If driver installer fails, try Compatibility mode or use generic Windows drivers.
step_4: Run Windows Update to fetch drivers automatically.
step_5: If still missing, try System Restore to a point before the issue.
verification: Audio input/output works for calls, recordings and media playback without distortion or dropouts.
log_snippet: Driver: Audio driver missing - driver installation failed

user_error_text: Distorted / crackling audio during calls or recordings
symptoms: Audio has pops, crackles, or distortion especially at certain volumes
cause: Interference, driver bug, sample rate mismatch, or failing hardware
step_1: Test with different headphones/speakers to rule out hardware.
step_2: Update audio drivers and set sample rate to default (e.g., 44100 Hz) in Advanced device properties.
step_3: Disable audio enhancements in playback device properties.
step_4: Try alternative USB port or powered hub for USB audio devices.
step_5: If persistent, try a different audio interface or consult repair for hardware issues.
verification: Audio input/output works for calls, recordings and media playback without distortion or dropouts.
log_snippet: System: Distorted / crackling audio - device disabled

user_error_text: Bluetooth audio not connecting on my laptop after a restart
symptoms: Bluetooth shows paired but no audio, or disconnects frequently
cause: Bluetooth driver issues, pairing problems, or interference
step_1: Remove the device from Bluetooth list and pair again.
step_2: Restart Bluetooth service and ensure device is set as default audio output.
step_3: Update Bluetooth and audio drivers from OEM site.
step_4: Move closer to the PC and remove other Bluetooth devices to reduce interference.
step_5: If still failing, reset the Bluetooth device (headphones) and try again.
verification: Audio input/output works for calls, recordings and media playback without distortion or dropouts.
log_snippet: Driver: Bluetooth audio not connecting - driver installation failed

cause: Bluetooth driver issues, pairing problems, or interference
step_1: Remove the device from Bluetooth list and pair again.
step_2: Restart Bluetooth service and ensure device is set as default audio output.
step_3: Update Bluetooth and audio drivers from OEM site.
step_4: Move closer to the PC and remove other Bluetooth devices to reduce interference.
step_5: If still failing, reset the Bluetooth device (headphones) and try again.
verification: Audio input/output works for calls, recordings and media playback without distortion or dropouts.
log_snippet: Kernel-Audio: Bluetooth audio not connecting - device init error

user_error_text: Headphones not detected when using headphones
symptoms: Plugging headphones shows no device change; audio still plays from speakers
cause: Jack detection issue, wrong port, or driver/registry problem
step_1: Try a different headphone jack or test headphones on another device.
step_2: Open Sound Control Panel → Playback devices and enable 'Show disabled devices' and 'Show disconnected devices'.
step_3: Update audio drivers and reinstall Realtek/HD audio driver package.
step_4: If laptop has combo jack, ensure headset wiring matches CTIA/AHJ standard.
step_5: Use USB headphones if analog jack is faulty or seek hardware repair.
verification: Audio input/output works for calls, recordings and media playback without distortion or dropouts.
log_snippet: Audio: Headphones not detected - endpoint not found

user_error_text: Microphone permissions blocked when using headphones
symptoms: Apps report 'microphone access denied' or cannot capture audio
cause: Privacy settings disabled or app-specific permission denied
step_1: Go to Settings → Privacy → Microphone and enable 'Allow apps to access your microphone'.
step_2: Check app-specific permissions in the same menu and toggle on.
step_3: Restart the app after changing permissions.
step_4: If using browser apps, check browser microphone permission in site settings.
step_5: If problems persist, reinstall the app or clear app cache.
verification: Audio input/output works for calls, recordings and media playback without distortion or dropouts.
log_snippet: System: Microphone permissions blocked - device disabled

user_error_text: USB microphone not recognized on my laptop after a restart
symptoms: USB mic not enumerated or shows as 'Unknown USB Device'
cause: Driver issue, insufficient power, or incompatible USB port
step_1: Try different USB port (use USB2 vs USB3) and avoid hubs where possible.
step_2: Install manufacturer's USB audio driver if available.
step_3: Check Device Manager for unknown devices and uninstall then rescan.
step_4: Ensure device draws enough power; use a powered USB hub if needed.
step_5: Test microphone on another computer to verify hardware health.
verification: Audio input/output works for calls, recordings and media playback without distortion or dropouts.
log_snippet: Driver: USB microphone not recognized - driver installation failed

user_error_text: Low microphone volume during calls or recordings
symptoms: Mic input is low even with high gain and loud speaking
cause: Low mic gain, incorrect levels, or defective mic capsule
step_1: Open Sound Control Panel → Recording → Properties → Levels and raise the microphone level and boost.
step_2: Disable AGC or automatic gain control in the app if it reduces volume.
step_3: Test with another mic or headset to compare levels.
step_4: Update drivers and ensure correct device selected in apps.
step_5: If hardware still low, replace mic or seek repair.
verification: Audio input/output works for calls, recordings and media playback without distortion or dropouts.
log_snippet: System: Low microphone volume - device disabled

step_4: Update drivers and ensure correct device selected in apps.
step_5: If hardware still low, replace mic or seek repair.
verification: Audio input/output works for calls, recordings and media playback without distortion or dropouts.
log_snippet: System: Low microphone volume - device disabled

user_error_text: Audio pops and clicks and the audio icon has a red X
symptoms: Intermittent pops/clicks during playback or recording
cause: Buffer underruns, USB interference, driver/hardware issues
step_1: Increase audio buffer size in audio app or device control panel.
step_2: Disable exclusive mode in Advanced settings of the audio device.
step_3: Try different USB cable/port and avoid long unshielded cables.
step_4: Update audio and chipset drivers to latest versions.
step_5: If persistent, use a dedicated audio interface for recording workloads.
verification: Audio input/output works for calls, recordings and media playback without distortion or dropouts.
log_snippet: Kernel-Audio: Audio pops and clicks - device init error
